rComments: The previous comment is completely untrue & isn't a reflection of who Prof. Singh is. I can vouch for all of the other reviews on this website except for the previous one. As a person of colour, I can say that Prof. Singh didnt display any favouritism & that she always marked fairly. She is the best prof. I had in 1st sem & Im so glad I took GGR197

Neera is one of the most knowledgeable, caring, humble, inspiring and engaged profs I have had so far. She is passionate about getting people to think, feel and be implicated in class, and the sources she chooses to work with are no less than brilliant. Wonderful experience.

Amazing prof! Love her style of teaching, she really cares about the material she is teaching and you will have a great time in her class if you do the readings and show up! You need to participate, show up to class!!! She likes essays and group projects not too many tests with her! She is the best!

Professor Singh is one of a kind. She kind, humble and approachable. Her Class was geared towards students shaping the materials and she would be among the best professor have taken at the University of Toronto. I would recommend her to any of my friends who would want to learn about the Indigenous Knowledge.

Dr Singh is very kind and passionate about her work. She sometimes gets overly concerned as to why students aren't participating but this is more due to the fact that we are all too overloaded by the program itself to really have time to have read all the required literature. She is sincerely helpful and knowledgeable.

Ridiculous amount of readings for just a few key points. She was approachable and nice (sometimes sarcastic though), tried to change the way class was done to make it better for students, but fell short (conflicting opinions). I don't get the marking style. Discussions were kinda pointless. Interesting topics but boring. Usually sleepy by 2nd hour.

If all social science profs conducted themselves like Neera, I would love the social sciences!  Neera is a humbly brilliant lady, and her heart is definitely in the right place.  Hers was the most innovative class I've taken at UofT - small weekly papers, well-chosen readings, good discussion, and NO exams.  UofT needs more like her!
